reviewText: A couple of notes here in that WWE started to show their support for the fight against cancer here by having the middle rope pink along with John Cena having a special pink colored "Rise Above Cancer" merchandise.  Also with Jerry Lawler recovering from his heart attack earlier in the week, J.B.L. returned to commentary alongside Michael Cole for the show.Intercontinental Champion The Miz vs. Rey Mysterio vs. Sin Cara vs. Cody Rhodes - With Miz being caught in the middle of Cody Rhodes' issues with Cara & Mysterio over their mask, we got a fatal four way match for the title.  As usual with these type of matches, it was filled with various highlights like it being a glorified tag match at times with Miz & Cody working together while Cara & Mysterio did the same, Cody & Miz trying to out do the other, Cody Rhodes actually getting some fan support, Mysterio & Cara facing off for the first time ever, and the match ending with a third masked man.  Great opening match full of non-stop action.WWE Tag Team Champions Kofi Kingston & R-Truth vs. Kane & Daniel Bryan - Before the match started, pay attention of J.B.L. as he had a funny time towards Kane's old adversary in Pete Rose.  Both teams traded momentum with Kofi & Truth working together while Kane & Bryan were working their singles offense including the way Bryan was able to get the No Lock on Kofi at one point. It backfired when Kane & Bryan attempted to work together only to result in a shoving match before hugging it out before there was a moment where it looked like Bryan was trying to save Kane only for him to take a shot at Kane himself that had a result that he didn't plan on or expect.  The match was average but more about continuing the "anger management" storyline between the two.WWE United States Champion Antonio Cesaro vs. Zack Ryder - Ryder got the title shot from winning the pre-show battle royal.  Cesaro was dominate from the start, with Aksana posing in different positions all over ringside, over Ryder including one move where he tossed Ryder up in the air only to catch in with an uppercut forearm on the way down.  Ryder was able to gain some control towards the end of the match but it was overall a dominate showcase for Cesaro.Randy Orton vs. Dolph Ziggler - Both men traded momentum early on with both men knowing each other so well that they had the others offense such as Orton able to counter Dolph's fameasser into a powerbomb while Dolph used Orton's old grounded headlock but bridged his body in order to add extra pressure before Orton took a page out of his father's playbook with a top rope superplex.  Orton went for his hanging DDT with Dolph able to counter forcing Orton to take it to the outside where Orton was able to hit it but hurt himself in the process before Dolph came back with a counter to the RKO & Orton countering Dolph's own sleeper as well.  This was a very competitive match between both men that resulting in the fans showing support for both men throughout the match.Divas Champion Layla vs. Eve - Kaitlyn was attacked earlier in the night causing SmackDown General Manager Booker T giving his assistant Eve the title shot.  Eve went for a headlock take down early only for Layla to counter into head scissors before Eve was able to escape only to still be taken down with an armdrag.  Layla tried to show some sportsmanship like Eve had been showing her & Kaitlyn for the past few weeks only for Eve to aggressively attack her including ramming her into the apron twice targeting the ribs followed up with a body scissors that did come into effect later on with Layla attempted a springboard kick only to land on her ribs.  This was one of the better divas matches in recent months.World Champion Sheamus vs. Alberto Del Rio - Booker T came out before the match to announce that Sheamus' Brouge Kick was no longer banned with Sheamus responding to that by knocking out David Otunga with the kick.  Both men battled with Del Rio giving headbutts & kicks while Sheamus gave a neckbreaker & shoulder block after Del Rio went through the ropes & landed back first on the floor but Rio targeted Sheamus' arm using the ringpost & various armbars including a full body one while he was hanging from the top rope.  Sheamus fought back beating on Rio's chest & countering Rio's attempts at the cross armbreaker various times before a miscalculation caused Sheamus' arm to still be attacked with Rio being ruthless in applying the cross armbreaker.  Just like their previous three PPV encounters, this was a solid match with great storytelling & selling in regards to Sheamus' arm.WWE Champion C.M. Punk vs. John Cena - Paul Heyman gave an introduction to "his guy" in Punk before his entrance while Punk work N.Y. Yankees style gear & held up the championship for an extreme amount of time just to get under the skin of the crowd.  Both men went back & forth with some wrestling early with Punk showing off to the point where he walked on Cena to go to the top rope which Cena had a response to in attempting an electric chair that was countered into a DDT by Punk followed by taking a page out of Great Muta's playbook with a his variation of a chinlock.  Cena got more aggressive throwing Punk into the crowd near his Dad before suplexing him back to ringside with Cena later going out of his comfort zone by doing a suicide dive onto the outside onto Punk.  Both men were matching each othe move for move & counter for counter like Punk at one moment caught Cena in the middle of one of his trademark moves into the anaconda vice that was rolled over into an STF that was countered into a crossface & later Cena was able to counter a GTS attempt into the STF before another GTS attempt that countered into an A.A.  Both men kept kicking out of each others signature moves while also attempting to aerial with Cena's top rope legdrop & Punk with a moonsault to the point where Punk even took a page out of The Rock's playbook to no avail.  Punk is one of those people who can pull the best wrestling performance out of Cena & that continues to be showcased here as this was on the level of their previous Money In The Bank & SummerSlam matches from last year with the only downfall being the finish but it opened the door for another match which is something I wouldn't object to.In the end, this PPV didn't have a bad match on it & was enjoyable from start to finish to it's worth a viewing.
summary: The Home Town Hero vs. "A Paul Heyman Guy"

reviewText: WWENIGHT OF CHAMPIONS 2012This event was held in Boston Massachusetts which of course is Cena's home town so naturally he got the title shot against the now longest reigning champ in modern WWE history. This ended up being a very good event with some great matches. The DVD has one special feature which is an interview with Booker T but I wish they would have added the preshow battle royal that Zack Ryder won as well.1.[I-C TITLE FATAL FOUR WAY MATCH]THE MIZ VS REY MYSTERIO VS SIN CARA VS CODY RHODES-the opening match of the night is a four way match for the I-C title with The Miz entering first with a mic stating his frustrations with the match. This is a pretty good four way match with some good spots throughout. The action picks up as it goes along but to be honest with these four I kinda expected a near classic at least. Still a good match but it would have been great to see Rey and Cara go at it more.2.[TAG TEAM TITLES]R TRUTH & KOFI KINGSTON VS KANE & DANIEL BRYAN-the second match of the night would be for the tag titles and would be a fun one to watch. Kofi & Truth work well together as the reigning champs but the fun is watching Kane and Bryan try to work together only to fall apart. The action is good here but much like how they won the contenders match Bryan and Kane win the titles by hurting each other, I love it.3.[US TITLE]ANTONIO CESARO VS ZACK RYDER-after winning a battle royal earlier in the evening Ryder earned a shot at the U.S. title. This wasn't too long of a match with Zack doing alright but this was more about showing off Cesaro. That uppercut looked like it hurt a lot, vicious looking indeed.4.DOLPH ZIGGLER VS RANDY ORTON-now this was a really good match right here full of back and forth action. The crowd was really into this one and rightfully so. I really liked the counters here in this match and the ending with Orton hitting the RKO was cool. This only adds to my claim that Dolph is always in one of the best if not best matches on the card.5.[DIVAS TITLE]LAYLA VS EVE-Kaitlyn was going to be the one getting the title shot but she was attacked earlier in the night and was forced out of the match. Layla now had a new opponent and at the beginning tried to show some sportsmanship only to have that turn on her. Eve really dominates this match even taking it to the outside and smashing Layla against the apron and the ring. This is a really good Divas match in my opinion.6.[WORLD TITLE]SHEAMUS VS ALBERTO DEL RIO-I have to say that I really did enjoy this feud and the whole banning of the Brouge kick and all that. So at the beginning of the match Booker T came out and reinstated the move which of course upset Del Rio. Any way this is a really good match between these two as Del Rio attacks Sheamus's arm while Sheamus is more of the brawler. I know it has been said in other reviews but the selling and storytelling here is really good. I still remember wanting Del Rio to win this but that was not to be. Good thing for Sheamus that that kick was allowed is all I am saying.7.[WWE TITLE]CM PUNK VS JOHN CENA-it seems like every time CM Punk faces John Cena Cena is in a much better match than he normally is. So any time these two face off I am excited about it. Going into this match John could not take that Punk is demanding respect and Punk could not stand that Cena does not give it to him. I loved that Paul Heyman came out to introduce Punk since he is a "Paul Heyman guy", can't wait to get that shirt by the way. This match is by far my favorite of the night full of high spots, pure wrestling, and multiple near falls which add to the drama. It also helps that this was in Cena's home town. The match was back and forth with Cena kept coming with the high impact moves and Punk more of the technician. Both countered each other well and even kicked out of each other's signature moves. Punk's moonsault and his Randy Savage elbow drop are still favorites of mine. Now as for the finish were most hated it I actually loved it, let me explain. The ending in which Cena belly to back suplexes Punk for the pin keeps the belt on Punk and still lets Cena save face in his home town, it also continues the storyline between the two. Do I prefer that Punk would straight up win, yes, but still I didn't mind the outcome.In the end I would say that I enjoyed the entire event and would say that this is worth buying. It has some great matches and would fit in with any collection one might have. For the most part this event helped put over some good storylines that were happening at the time. In the end it was an entertaining PPV and that is all we can really ask for right?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a PPV that was only mainly for just to see the hometown boy, John Cena to attempt to topple the champion, CM Punks reign of 302 day for good. It's all about wanting to watch Punk in his Chicago White Socks outfit finally walk into the lion's den to try to retain, but will he?These are only 5 out 7 matches, but the ones which are worthy:* The Miz, Rey Mysterio, Cody Rhodes, and Sin Cara in a Fatal 4 Way for the Intercontinental Title 7.5/10* R-Truth and Kofi Kingston vs Kane and Daniel Bryan for the Tag Titles 7.5/10* Randy Orton vs Dolph Ziggler (with Vickie Guerrero) 8-10* Sheamus vs Alberto Del Rio for the World Heavyweight Title 8/10* CM Punk vs John Cena for the WWE Title 10/10* Divas Title and U.S. Title Match 0/10 each- Overall, this show is 8.5/10
Title: N/A

reviewText: JBL replacs LawlerMatch of the Night Or Match of the yearMain Event - CM Punk Vs John Cena 3 for the WWE Championship - one word "CLASSIC" this match was excellent and its probably the greatest NOC match ever or its easily one of the best matches of all time i mean so many false finishes and punk does a rock bottom and cena kiced out and cena does a suicide dive at that point i think i was in imagination land but nope it was real again this is One of WWE'S matches of the YearWinner and Still Champ by draw : CM Punk2 other Candidates for MOTN AKA "Match Of The Night" areSheamus Vs Del Rio for the Whvt Title - this was a very good world title match Del Rio targeted Sheamus's Arm like usual but told a great story at the same time both of hese guys work very well together and the brogue kick was reinstated and Sheamus tryed to end it early like he did at Wrestlemania 28 but nope and eventually he gives ADR a brouge kick and WinsWinner and still champ : SheamusRandy Orton vs Doplh Ziggler - This was an awesome and great pure wrestling match  i mean no gig's used just an great match by orton and by dolph like usual from them , this wasnt the first they faced each other , theyve fought on raw and sd more than once in the past yr and always great but this best against each other this easily 2nd match of the nightWinner : Randy OrtonBest 4 way of the yrMiz Vs Mysterio Vs Rhodes vs Cara - this was one of my favorite 4 ways by wwe in the past yr or this yr easily cause this really enjoyable nice sports by all 4 men , hilarious ending , rey and cara have a one on one segment witch was "yay" for me but again really enjoyable match but the miz wins thts the bed part of itWinner and still champ : The MizDecent Tag matchTeam Hell No vs Truth and Kofi - This was what i call a decent tag match for the tag titles but confusing as is why are 2 rivals like bryan and kane a team and working well together , plus ofi and truth tryed to make them look good but didnt work out well and the ending was expected , but later on they argue by saying " im the tag champs" then kane dumps water on aj,shelby,bryan and says "im going to disneyland" witch is funnyWinners and new champs : bryan and kaneWorst matches of the ppvEve Torres vs Layla - ugh i didnt enjoy this match even tho layla is great looking and eve is well same thing lol cause shes a latina and has well good legs lol anyways but they try to have a great match but nopewinner and new champ : eveCesaro Vs Ryder - for the us title and ryder got the chance by winning a pre-show battle royal tbh if this 2 out of 3 falls and ryder wasnt dumb and aksana wasnt there then id like this match but tbh it suckedwinner and still champ : cesarooverall : Amazing PPV and yes im a guy and i think eve is pretty but what guy doesnt lolbut ppv rating = 8.5/10i recommned this to buy on dvd for any wrestling fan and a perfect christmas gift cause of Punk/Cena
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Fatal Four-Way match for the Intercontinental title had nice high-flying from both Rey Mysterio and Sin Cara with nice wrestling action from both The Miz and Cody Rhodes. The Tag Team title match between the team of Kofi Kingston and R-Truth against the team of Kane and Daniel Bryan had pretty good tag action even with the dumb ending. The United States title match between Antonio and Zack Ryder was a solid hard-hitting bout. The Randy Orton-Dolph Ziggler match was a back-and-forth bout. The Divas title match between Layla and Eve Torres was a brutal ground-and-pound yet one-sided bout. The Worlds title match between Sheamus and Alberto Del Rio was a smash-mouth bout. The WWE title match between CM Punk and John Cena started off pretty good but later got turned into intense,heart-pounding, nail-biting bout even with the double-pin draw in the end. I give this event a 8 out of 10.

reviewText: This is not a review of the Pay-Per-View Event itself but is more of a review of the match listing on the back of the DVD case. I just wanted to point out to everyone that has this WWE Pay-Per-View Event on DVD and to anyone that is going to buy it in the future that if you look at the match listing shown on the back of the DVD case you will or might notice that the match listing is not complete and does not list the Fatal Four Way Match for the Intercontinental Championship featuring Intercontinental Champion The Miz vs Cody Rhodes vs Sin Cara vs Rey Mysterio for some stupid reason.
summary: Match listing on back of DVD case not complete
